issue.title: source and build_production out of sync?
issue.body: Just recently cloned the project to contribute but noticed the build_production and the source dir seem out of sync for example ``` source/docs/deploying-your-site.md ``` does not show the --env=production that the build_production files does.  Am I missing something?

issue.title: Added reset button helper.
issue.body: Added reset button helper, similar to the submit button helper. This will allow cleaner syntax being used to create a reset button. It's not much, but just a cleaner way of rendering the button for the form.

comment.body: Throw a test on there similar to the Submit button test and I'll merge it in 👍

issue.title: Using data-* attributes
issue.body:
Hi,

Is there a way I can set data-* attributes on a form element using BootForms?

Any ideas would be great..

Thanks

issue.title: Using data-* attributes
issue.body:
Hi,

Is there a way I can set data-* attributes on a form element using BootForms?

Any ideas would be great..

Thanks

comment.body:
Yup! 

`BootForm::text('First Name', 'first_name')->data('foo', 'bar')`

... should do it.

issue.title: Remove '/Users/' prefix
issue.body: If someone uses different home directory (like me) it does not work.

comment.body:
Here were our steps to resolving:

1. Run `sudo brew services stop dnsmasq` to kill the background dnsmasq process
2. Manually start dnsmasq in the foreground using `sudo /usr/local/opt/dnsmasq/sbin/dnsmasq --keep-in-foreground -C /usr/local/etc/dnsmasq.conf` and look for errors
3. We saw that dnsmasq was complaining that `dnsmasq: failed to create listening socket for 192.168.10.1: Permission denied`
4. We know dnsmasq runs on port 53, so check for other services on port 53 with `sudo lsof -i :53`
5. Saw Python was running on the port, turns out it was a Plex related thing.
6. Killed the Python process, ran `valet install` again.
7. Everything is working gloriously.

issue.title: Remove '/Users/' prefix
issue.body: If someone uses different home directory (like me) it does not work.

comment.body:
@vegamx The problem @sagalbot was having was related to running Plex, which was using port 53 for it's DNS stuff, causing dnsmasq not to start properly. Stopping Plex allowed Valet to start properly.

Try running `sudo lsof -i :53` to find out if anything is already running on port 53 on your machine to see if it's a similar issue.

issue.title: Remove '/Users/' prefix
issue.body: If someone uses different home directory (like me) it does not work.

comment.body:
Try deleting the first line (the import directive) from `~/.valet/Caddyfile` and running:

`sudo ~/.composer/vendor/laravel/valet/bin/caddy --conf=/Volumes/Documents/sagalbot/.valet/Caddyfile`

...again

issue.title: Remove '/Users/' prefix
issue.body: If someone uses different home directory (like me) it does not work.

comment.body:
Try this as well:

`sudo ~/.composer/vendor/laravel/valet/bin/caddy --conf=/Users/sagalbot/.valet/Caddyfile`

...then see if your sites work

issue.title: Remove '/Users/' prefix
issue.body: If someone uses different home directory (like me) it does not work.

comment.body:
Try:

```
rm -rf ~/.composer/vendor
rm ~/.composer/composer.lock
composer global update
```

...just to be sure have fresh files, maybe Composer didn't make the symlink to `~/.composer/vendor/bin`
